definition: breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Mr Nogaideli claims that the Kremlin is backsliding[5].
sentences.chinese: 诺盖杰利声称是克里姆林宫背信弃义的。

sentences.english: America's betrayal of the democratic parties was the main reason for the disbandment of Democratic League.
sentences.chinese: 美国对民主党派的背信弃义，是民盟解散的一大原因。

sentences.english: I'm tired of you ratting on me.
sentences.chinese: 我厌倦了你对我的背信弃义。

sentences.english: He is the ultimate symbol of treachery.
sentences.chinese: 犹大成为了背信弃义的终极形象。

sentences.english: Mystery, and perhaps treachery, surrounds the couple’s death.
sentences.chinese: 缠绕这对情侣的死因的是神秘，也许是背信弃义。

sentences.english: Can you think I would be so heartlessly treacherous?
sentences.chinese: 难道你认为我会那样残酷地背信弃义？

sentences.english: Crook had resigned his post rather than be party to such treachery.
sentences.chinese: 克鲁克已经辞职了，不愿参与这种背信弃义的行为。

sentences.english: Whatever be the reasons for it, we cannot tolerate this disloyalty.
sentences.chinese: 无论是何原因，我们都不能容忍这种背信弃义的行为。

sentences.english: As devotion unites lovers, perfidy estranges friends.
sentences.chinese: 忠心团结爱人，背信弃义疏离朋友。

sentences.english: V 4 I'm tired of you ratting on me.
sentences.chinese: 我厌倦了你对我的背信弃义。

sentences.english: Marlowe was killed by a man whom he was treacherously trying to stab.
sentences.chinese: 马洛背信弃义正想捅死一人，结果被那人所杀。

definition: to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to break faith
injustice
treason
to abandon/to desert/to renounce
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
to betray
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
to betray one's country
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
